title: Jump Game VI
description: You are given an integer array nums and an integer k. You start at the first index of the array and you can jump at most k indices forward in the array. Your goal is to reach the last index and calculate the maximum score you can obtain. The score is defined as the sum of the values of the elements you land on during your jumps, including the starting and ending indices. You need to return the maximum score you can achieve.
input_format: An integer array nums, followed by an integer k.
output_format: An integer representing the maximum score possible.

examples.explanation: You can jump from index 0 to index 1 (1), then to index 2 (2), and finally to index 4 (4). The sum is 1 + 2 + 4 = 10.
You can jump from index 0 to 4. The sum is 10 + 10 = 20.

hints: Consider using a sliding window to maintain the maximum possible scores.
You may store scores in a separate array to track the maximum at each position.

title: Missing Number
description: Given an array containing n distinct numbers taken from 0, 1, 2, ..., n, find the one number that is missing from the array.
input_format: An array nums of n distinct integers.
output_format: An integer representing the missing number.

examples.explanation: The numbers in the range are 0, 1, 2, 3. The missing number is 2.
The numbers in the range are 0, 1, 2. The missing number is 2.

hints: The sum of the first n natural numbers can help find the missing number.
Consider using the XOR operation for an efficient solution.

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
description: You are given an array where each element represents the price of a stock on a given day. Your task is to find the maximum profit you can achieve by choosing a single day to buy one stock and a different day in the future to sell that stock. If you cannot achieve any profit, return 0.
input_format: An array of integers prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the i-th day.
output_format: An integer representing the maximum profit you can achieve.

examples.explanation: Buying on day 2 (price = 1) and selling on day 5 (price = 6) yields a profit of 6 - 1 = 5.
In this case, no transactions are done and the max profit is 0.

hints: Keep track of the minimum price seen so far.
Calculate the profit at each step and keep the maximum profit.
